ygData.subject: RE: Reduced Taunt?
ygData.msgSnippet: Yes but don t ya think increasing the radius of Selo s might increase the radius at which it agros mobs as well?  That could be why even though you were far
ygData.messageBody:
Yes but don't ya think increasing the radius of Selo's might increase the
radius at which it agros mobs as well? That could be why even though you
were far enough away, it no longer was far enough due to the increased Selo
radius.

Kit

-----Original Message-----
From: Peck White [mailto:peck_white@...]
Sent: Friday, February 04, 2000 1:34 PM
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Reduced Taunt?


From: Peck White <peck_white@...>

On a similar note,

Last night I was in NK on my way to Halas. I was at
the wooden bridge when a druid came running down the
road being chased by Grimfeather, a kite gone bad I
think. I ran up the shore to the north to stay out of
Grim's aggro radius. I also fired up Selo's "just in
case". As soon as the druid zoned Grim came straight
at me. Not up the road and then turning toward me,
but in a straight beeline. To make a long story
short, I went from full health to dead before I could
zone. I was never closer than 150 yds to him before
he attacked. I'm sure glad the Taunt has been
reduced.

Tomerrilin
Bard of the 22nd, 23rd, 22nd song
Mith Marr

--- "Kimes, Dean W." <Dean_Kimes@...>
wrote:
> Hmmm, that is awfully similar to my near death last
> nite. A Paladin and his
